greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The pi-based arithmetic derivative of n: a(p) = pi(p) for p prime, a(u*v) = a(u)*v + u*a(v), where pi = A000720.
comment: The pi-based variant of the arithmetic derivative of n (A003415).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
formula: a(n) = n * Sum e_j*pi(p_j)/p_j for n = Product p_j^e_j with pi = A000720.
a(A258861(n)) = n; A258861 = pi-based antiderivative of n.
a(a(A258862(n))) = n; A258862 = second pi-based antiderivative of n.
a(a(a(A258995(n)))) = n; A258995 = third pi-based antiderivative of n.
mathematica: a[n_] := n*Total[Last[#]*PrimePi[First[#]]/First[#]& /@ FactorInteger[n]]; a[0] = 0; Array[a, 100, 0] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 24 2016 *)
program: (PARI) A258851(n)=n*sum(i=1, #n=factor(n)~, n[2, i]*primepi(n[1, i])/n[1, i]) \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 13 2015
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 12 2015
